sentence.Network_en: Conditions in prisons out there are unimaginably bad.
sentence.Network_cn: 那里的监狱条件恶劣得无法想象。

sentence.Network_en: The business that sheds without content is adv unimaginably.
sentence.Network_cn: 没有物流的企业是难以想象的.

sentence.Network_en: I am adv unimaginably Maidangna has given birth to the child actually really.
sentence.Network_cn: 我真是难以想象麦当娜竟然生过孩子.

PerfectNetExp.abs: even the tiniest defect deprives of consummation . Natsun usually follow unimaginably stringent inspection standards in order to release perfectness . even the tiniest defect will be identified .差半步，也不叫完美。执著于追求完美境界的的南山人秉持常人难以想象的苛刻质检标准，精益求精，即使再细微的瑕疵，也无处藏身。
adv. unimaginably 不可思议地 inquiring adj. showing an interest in knowing about things 爱探索的,好问的 e.g. Teachers should encourage children to have.

list.abs: I think the willfully unimaginative see more monsters ., 我认为 , 缺乏想象力的人会看到更多的恶魔.
- Most unimaginated 最无法想象的 - You will move me there 您会把我移到那儿 - Yes, I know 是,我清楚 - I have taught you well 我把您教导得很.
匪_百度百科 ... 匪徒[ bandit] 匪夷所思[ unimaginably queer] 匪 bandit； brigand； robber；.
a colorless and unimaginative person a colorless description of the parade ., 无趣的 , 没有想象力的人 ; 对游行的无趣的描写.

entry.tran: 不可想象的；难以理解的；异乎寻常的
entry.def: If you describe something as unimaginable, you are emphasizing that it is difficult to imagine or understand properly, because it is not part of people's normal experience.

example.ex: The scale of the fighting is almost unimaginable...
example.tran: 战斗的规模几乎无法想象。

example.ex: The children here have lived through unimaginable horrors.
example.tran: 这里的孩子经历了难以想象的恐惧。

auth_sentence.content: The earth is a small speck in an unimaginably vast universe.
